detaileddescription.para: The experiment this scheduler serves.
The actual simulation clock for this scheduler.
The event-list used by the scheduler.

Flag to indicate whether the current simulation is running or stopped. If true, the simulation is stopped, if false, the simulation is still running. This flag is especially polled by processes exiting any synchronized method used for passivating the process thus giving control back to the scheduler.
Contains the event-note used by the current Schedulables.
Contains the current active Entity.
Contains the current active Entity.
Contains the current active Entity.
Contains the current active SimProcess.
Contains the current active Event.
Contains the Schedulable that has created the current EventNode
Contains the current active model.
Contains the current active Schedulable. This is either the entity or simProcess if available, or the external event, if none of the first two are available.
Flag indicating if the event-list will process concurrent Events in random order or not. Default is not (false). (Modification by Ruth Meyer, 11/2001)
The execution speed rate. Default is zero (as-fast-as-possible). (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 05/2009)
The point in physical time (real time) of the last change of the execution speed rate (in nanoseconds). (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 05/2009)
The point in simulation time of the last change of the execution speed rate or the last time the simulation was stopped . (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 05/2009)
Flag indicating if the the execution speed rate was changed or the experiment was stopped since the last call of processNextEventNote(). (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 05/2009)
Lock for process synchronisation during a realtime execution. (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 06/2009)
The condition used for process synchronisation during a realtime execution.
A threadsafte consumer/producer queue to store RealTimeEventWrapper-Objects send by external systems
Constructs a scheduler with given name and the event-list (i.e. inheritor of desmoj.core.simulator.EventList) to use.

parameterdescription.para: Experiment : The experiment that uses this Scheduler
java.lang.String : The scheduler's name
EventList : The event-list to store scheduled events

detaileddescription.para: Returns if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not.

simplesect.para: boolean: true if concurrent Events are randomized, false otherwise
Ruth Meyer

detaileddescription.para: Returns a string representation of the current state of the event-list. The string is built by concatenating all string representations of the contained entities, events and TimeInstant objects calling their toString() methods.

simplesect.para: java.lang.String : The string representation of the queuelist

detaileddescription.para: Returns the actual simulation time as displayed by the simulation clock.

simplesect.para: TimeInstant : The current point in simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Returns the currently active Entity. Returns null if the current Schedulable happens to be an external event or a simprocess. Note that in case the current Event refers to more than one entity (EventOfTwoEntities, EventOfThreeEntitties), only the first entity is returned; to obtain all such entities, use getAllCurrentEntities() instead.

simplesect.para: Entity : The currently active Entity or null in case of an external event or a simprocess being the currently active Schedulable

detaileddescription.para: Returns the currently active entities. Returns an empty list if the current Schedulable happens to be an external event or a SimProcess.

simplesect.para: List<Entity> : A list containing the currently active entities

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current active Event or null. Note that this method can also return an external event that can not be handled like an Event since it does not support scheduling together with an entity. Returns null if the current Schedulable happens to be a Sim-process that has been activated, thus no kind of Event is associated with it.

simplesect.para: Event : The currently active Event or external event or null if the current Schedulable happens to be an activated SimProcess

detaileddescription.para: Returns the currently active model.

simplesect.para: Model : The currently active model or null in case of no model being connected so far.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the Schedulable object that as created the current EventNode, thus being responsible for what is going on at the moment

simplesect.para: Schedulable : The source of the currently active object(s).

detaileddescription.para: Returns the currently active Schedulable object. This can be any of its subtypes Entity, SimProcess or external event in that order. For events referring to multiple enities, the first entity is returned.

simplesect.para: Schedulable : The currently active Schedulable

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current SimProcess. Note that this method can only return a Sim-process. If the currently active Schedulable is not instance of Sim-process or an external event, null is returned.

simplesect.para: SimProcess : The currently active SimProcess or null

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current execution Speed Rate.

simplesect.para: double : The current execution speed rate.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the actual clock for this model.

simplesect.para: SimClock : The actual clock for simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Processes the next event-note on the event-list. Returns true if that EventNote has been processed correctly, false if an error occurred or the event-list is empty.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the next event-note was processed correctly, false if not

detaileddescription.para: This method is called to notify simulator about the time passed between the execution of two events with a positive (non-zero) offset. The implementation of this method just sets the scheduler's clock to the new instant; note, though, that extensions to DESMO-J may overwrite this method to conduct more complex operations, e.g. extrapolate variables in continuous simulation.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The current point in simulation time
TimeInstant : The next point in simulation time to advance the clock to (e.g. instant of the next event)

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the external event to happen at the simulation time equivalent to the current value of wall-clock time.

parameterdescription.para: ExternalEvent : The external event to be scheduled

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen after a specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
TimeSpan : The point in simulation time for the event to happen as an offset to the current simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen at the specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time for the event to happen

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen after a specified time span. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
Event : The event to manipulate the entity
TimeSpan : The point in simulation time for the event to happen as an offset to the current simulation time

memberdef.argsstring: (Entity who1, Entity who2, EventOf2Entities<?,?> what, TimeSpan dt)
memberdef.name: schedule

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen after a specified time span. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
EventOf2Entities : The event to manipulate the two entities
TimeSpan : The point in simulation time for the event to happen as an offset to the current simulation time

memberdef.argsstring: (Entity who1, Entity who2, Entity who3, EventOf3Entities<?,?,?> what, TimeSpan dt)
memberdef.name: schedule

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen after a specified time span. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
Entity : The third entity to be scheduled
EventOf3Entities : The event to manipulate the two entities
TimeSpan : The point in simulation time for the event to happen as an offset to the current simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen at the specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
Event : The event to manipulate the entity
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time for the event to happen

memberdef.argsstring: (Entity who1, Entity who2, EventOf2Entities<?,?> what, TimeInstant when)
memberdef.name: schedule

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen at the specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
EventOf2Entities : The event to manipulate the entity
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time for the event to happen

memberdef.argsstring: (Entity who1, Entity who2, Entity who3, EventOf3Entities<?,?,?> what, TimeInstant when)
memberdef.name: schedule

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the event to happen at the specified time. Checks that only legal combinations of valid parameters are scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
Entity : The third entity to be scheduled
EventOf3Entities : The event to manipulate the entity
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time for the event to happen

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight after the given Schedulable is set to be activated. Note that the siulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly after the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable after which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
Event : The event to be scheduled

memberdef.argsstring: (Schedulable after, Entity who1, Entity who2, EventOf2Entities<?,?> what)
memberdef.name: scheduleAfter

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight after the given Schedulable is set to be activated. Note that the siulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly after the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable after which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
EventOf2Entities : The event to be scheduled

memberdef.argsstring: (Schedulable after, Entity who1, Entity who2, Entity who3, EventOf3Entities<?,?,?> what)
memberdef.name: scheduleAfter

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight after the given Schedulable is set to be activated. Note that the siulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly after the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable after which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
Entity : The third entity to be scheduled
EventOf3Entities : The event to be scheduled

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight before the given Schedulable is scheduled. Note that the simulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly before the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable before which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The Entity to be scheduled
Event : The event to be scheduled

memberdef.argsstring: (Schedulable before, Entity who1, Entity who2, EventOf2Entities<?,?> what)
memberdef.name: scheduleBefore

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight before the given Schedulable is scheduled. Note that the simulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly before the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable before which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
EventOf2Entities : The event to be scheduled

memberdef.argsstring: (Schedulable before, Entity who1, Entity who2, Entity who3, EventOf3Entities<?,?,?> what)
memberdef.name: scheduleBefore

detaileddescription.para: Schedules the given Entity and Event to happen straight before the given Schedulable is scheduled. Note that the simulation time for the newly entered EventNote will be set to the Schedulable's time and the new EventNote will be inserted directly before the Schedulable's EventNote.

parameterdescription.para: Schedulable : The Schedulable before which the new event-note is to be scheduled
Entity : The first entity to be scheduled
Entity : The second entity to be scheduled
Entity : The third entity to be scheduled
EventOf3Entities : The event to be scheduled

detaileddescription.para: Sets the execution speed rate.

parameterdescription.para: double : the execution speed rate

simplesect.para: Felix Klueckmann

detaileddescription.para: Sets the flag indicating if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not. If a change occurred the event-list has to be changed accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: boolean :true forces random order, false forces "linear" order

simplesect.para: Ruth Meyer

detaileddescription.para: Signals that the experiment is stopped.

simplesect.para: Felix Klueckmann

detaileddescription.para: Preempts the currently running SimProcess. Method is called whenenver another Entity or SimProcess is scheduled with TimeSpan.ZERO or presentTime() as parameter for the simulation time. The current SimProcess is interrupted and will be scheduled to continue its lifecycle

parameterdescription.para: EventNote - The event-note of the Schedulable preempting the current SimProcess

detaileddescription.para: Creates and sends a debugnote to the experiment's messagedistributor. These debugnotes express the internal state of the event-list to visualize the changes of state to help find bugs. Classes Scheduler and Queue both produce debugnotes if set to do so representing the data stored inside them. The information about the simulation time is extracted from the experiment and must not be given as a parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the event-list's internal state to be passed with this debugnote

detaileddescription.para: Returns the status of the current simulation. Clients should not need to use this method explicitly. This method is polled by each thread when it exits a lock to check wether it should continue its lifeCycle() method ot throw a SimulationFinishedException, which seems to be the only legal way to break out of the deep call hierarchies and stop the Process' lifeCycle.

simplesect.para: boolean : state of the simulation. False if still running, true if the simulation has already finished correctly

detaileddescription.para: The scheduler is the main element controlling the run of a simulation. It controls the event-list in which all scheduled events are stored, picks the next event to be processed and advances the simulation clock accordingly.
